00102 #include <LinAlg/arrayoptimize.h>

00183 void cblnsrch
00184 (
00185     Array< double >& xold,
00186     double fold,        /* evaluation at the current solution */
00187     Array< double >& g, /* current gradient */
00188     Array< double >& p, /* search direction */
00189     Array< double >& x, /* returns the new solution */
00190     double& f,
00191     double (*func)( const Array< double >& ),
00192     double lambda
00193 )
00194 {
00195     //
00196     // the maximum of performed iterations should be choosen small enough
00197     // to ensure that neither (3^iterMax) nor (0.1^(2*iterMax)) causes a
00198     // numerical overflow or underflow.
00199     //
00200     const unsigned iterMax = 20;
00201 
00202     unsigned iterNum;
00203     unsigned i, n;
00204     bool     tst = false;
00205     double   slope;
00206     double   alpha, alpha2;
00207     double   alpha_prev, alpha_prev2;
00208     double   alpha_tmp = 0;
00209     double   f1, f2, fprev = 0;
00210     double   a, b, c;
00211     double   cm11, cm12, cm21, cm22;
00212     double   disc;
00213 
00214     n = xold.nelem( );
00215 
00216     /*
00217      * dot product of search direction and gradient
00218      */
00219     for( slope = 0., i = 0; i < n; i++ )
00220         slope += g( i ) * p( i );
00221 
00222     iterNum = 0;                        /* iteration counter */
00223     alpha   = 1.;                       /* updating step */
00224 
00225     /*
00226      * updating
00227      */
00228     for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
00229         x( i ) = xold( i ) + alpha * p( i );
00230     f = func( x );
00231     iterNum++;
00232 
00233     /*
00234      * Implementing Goldstein's test for alpha too small
00235      */
00236     while( f < fold + ( 1. - lambda )*alpha*slope && iterNum < iterMax ) {
00237         alpha *= 3;
00238         for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
00239             x( i ) = xold( i ) + alpha * p( i );
00240         f = func( x );
00241         iterNum++;
00242     }
00243     if( iterNum >= iterMax )
00244         std::cerr << "Alpha over flowed!" << std::endl;
00245 
00246     //std::cerr << "alpha = " << alpha << "\titerNum = " << iterNum << std::endl;
00247 
00248     /*
00249      * Armijo's test for alpha too large
00250      */
00251     alpha_prev = alpha; /* H.L. Deng, 6/13/95 */
00252     while( f > fold + lambda*alpha*slope && iterNum < iterMax ) {
00253         alpha2 = alpha * alpha;
00254         f1 = f - fold - slope * alpha;
00255 
00256         if( tst == false ) {
00257             alpha_tmp = -slope * alpha2 / ( f1 * 2. ); /* tentative alpha */
00258             tst = true;
00259         } else {
00260             alpha_prev2 = alpha_prev * alpha_prev;
00261             f2   = fprev - fold - alpha_prev * slope;
00262 
00263             c    = 1. / (alpha - alpha_prev);
00264             cm11 = 1. / alpha2;
00265             cm12 = -1. / alpha_prev2;
00266             cm21 = -alpha_prev / alpha2;
00267             cm22 = alpha / alpha_prev2;
00268 
00269             a    = c * ( cm11 * f1 + cm12 * f2 );
00270             b    = c * ( cm21 * f1 + cm22 * f2 );
00271             disc = b * b - 3. * a * slope;
00272 
00273             if( ( fabs( a ) > FLT_MIN ) && ( disc > FLT_MIN ) )
00274                 alpha_tmp = ( -b + sqrt( disc ) ) / ( 3. * a );
00275             else
00276                 alpha_tmp = slope * alpha2 / ( 2. * f1 );
00277 
00278             if( alpha_tmp >= .5 * alpha )
00279                 alpha_tmp = .5 * alpha;
00280         }
00281         alpha_prev = alpha;
00282         fprev = f;
00283 
00284         if( alpha_tmp < .1 * alpha )
00285             alpha *= .1;
00286         else
00287             alpha = alpha_tmp;
00288 
00289         for( i = 0; i < n; i++ )
00290             x( i ) = xold( i ) + alpha * p( i );
00291         f = func( x );
00292         iterNum++;
00293     }
00294     if( iterNum >= iterMax )
00295         std::cerr << "Alpha under flowed!" << std::endl;
00296 
00297     //std::cerr << "alpha = " << alpha << "\titerNum = " << iterNum << std::endl;
00298 }
